other_tests.findings: Pooling of secretions and severe oropharyngeal weakness; swallowing of blue-dyed liquid triggered frank aspiration with minimal epiglottic movement.

Normal esophagus and mild, diffuse, chronic gastritis; chronic inflammatory changes and intestinal metaplasia in biopsies from the stomach and duodenum; distal esophagus appeared inflamed without histologic abnormality.
Normal airways; hazy, colorless fluid containing neutrophils, with negative Gram staining and a rare amount of methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus and Candida albicans.
Diffuse, spontaneous activity with myotonic discharges of the right triceps, biceps, and tibialis anterior.
Normal head, brain stem, and neck.
